intro: Nemastylis brunnea, commonly known as the brown nemastylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Nemastylis brunnea is native to parts of Asia and is often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates.
